Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2008 11:52AM ccare wrote: Thanks for your reply.  It is wait and see and I guess validation for how upset I feel is perfect.  This is a crazy experience.  I am grateful you took the time to write, thank you.  I will keep checking back, this has helped.  I will let my surgeon know of my experience.  She is so well known here in KC but the hospital she is connected to has a bad rep.  Everyone warned me, but I wanted her so.......There are other good choices for second opinions if needed.  One step at a time and Monday may be a good start.  I will stay on it for sure.  AS with anyone who responds to help, I will hold you in my thoughts.....I hope all is ok for you.....
Posts.Title: Now what to do? ccare ccare

Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2008 06:57PM - edited Dec 27, 2008 07:00PM by ccare Thank you for responding.  OK, excellent thought about "only a path report can rule it B9 or not"  I did hear that once a few weeks ago, but he was so certain but cocky and condescending, like it was all no big deal, like I was over reacting (maybe I was?)......  He smirked when I expressed my ambivilance about his dx. based on my pics.  When I asked him how my surgeon did not catch this, he said, and I quote, "this is something we in radiology have known for years and the surgeons have not caught on yet"   WHAT?.....I'm sorry I will not belabor this experience. More questions if anyone can answer.... Who rules here, him or my surgeon?  Will she be so quick to trust his reading of my pics? To answer you, YES, UNFORTUNATELY THIS WAS A BREAST CARE CLINIC!  SHOCKING (but I have to take some resp.  I was warned but I really did not want to give up this surgeon....also a breast surgeon, it's all she does....she is lovely).  OK, I feel like I have taken enough time.  I will call Monday first thing.  I will post as this progresses.  Thank you very much.
Posts.Title: Now what to do? ccare ccare

My best to you.

Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2008 11:45AM ccare wrote: Thank you.  Maybe that is it, I just need to be heard.....You are kind.  I will talk to the surgeon on Monday I hope.  My family wants me to have the surgical biopsy regardless and maybe a second opinion.  One day at a time.  I know you are here too.  I hope you are ok as can be.  My thoughts go with you, thank you for reaching out to me, you made a difference.
Posts.Title: Now what to do? ccare ccare

Posts.Content: ccare wrote: Hi, forgive me if this all is not stated correctly......I will try hard to be short.  I am new here and was hoping I could find some help via your thoughts.  Long journey like most here it seems. Dx last mo. with cluster of microcals and suspicious lump elsewhere but same breast.  VERY dense breasts. Saw surgeon and now have waited almost a month for today when I suppose to have two kinds of biopsies, core and stereo tactic. God the emotions and anticipation..... Took day off, arrived.  First the ultrasound, too many cysts radiologist decided not to biopsy (not even the one surgeon ordered a biopsy on), I was then moved and prepped for the stereo tactic, lots of trouble as the area of microcals are too close to chest wall and, according to nurse, "he's probably not going to do this one either, you'll need surgery"  A lot of pain with pressure from machine on breast.  Radiologist kept ordering more pics. then back and forth to mammograms.  He came in (abruptly) and said the mircocals are layered.  I asked to see what he was talking about (he got all annoyed).  He showed me and said "benign"  AND, you have Fibrocystic (sp?) Breast Disease.  I'll tell your surgeon.....He walked me to the door and shut the door once I was just outside it.  I was left standing in a hallway, with no one around, in my hospital gown, without my key to go and get my clothes.....AND I have left a lot out, he was horrible. The experience shocking and all I could do was cry.  I wanted to be happy but I do not know what to feel.   I need help.  I called my surgeon but she is off until Monday.  I don't understand what I am suppose to do now?  NO BIOPSY and after all this scare I am just suppose to drop this?  Will she tell me what to do next?  I have EVERY risk factor, under 50, my mom had same kind with mastectomy, I've had no kids, never breast fed, my microcals are all funny shapes and sizes (appears to be in situ) one outside cluster.  What do I ask the surgeon.  Should I request the surgical biopsy?  Should I wait?  And the layered part, is it always benign?  Anyone?  I feel so lost and I want to feel happy but I am not settled and I am shocked at how this was handled. Am I over reacting? Why do I feel so bewildered when I should be jumping for joy?   How should I communicate with my surgeon?  Has this happened to anyone?  Thanks for listening and for your help.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Now what to do? ccare ccare

Posts.Content: Dec 28, 2008 10:55AM ccare wrote: I cannot begin to tell you all how much you have helped me!  I am in a better place as I spent last night doing my own research based on a few key words I remember the radiologist saying.  If I am correct, it appears that I may have "Milk of Calcium", basically, microcals that form in the milk duct that are TYPICALLY B9 (a few studies have shown that CA can exist just the same).  Biopsies are usually not required and they dx them based on mammograms and the way they appear, linear with an upward curve shape, in layers.  Often they are smudged in appearance but mine are not and mine are well defined with different shapes and sizes in the cluster.....I also have one outside the cluster. So that will have to be considered I suppose.  He did seem 100% sure.....  I deeply appreciate all your advice and will discuss with my surgeon tomorrow and hear her thoughts.  I will ask her to look at the newest pics and tell me what she thinks is the best plan based on her experience with these.  In addition I may seek another surgeon for a back up given the risk factors.  I did not know of the high risk breast clinics, thank you that is an excellent thought.  I know for sure I will not return to the first one.  There are some other really excellent ones here,  KU med. for example.   You have all empowered me so much, I am so blessed.  My new years gift is in all of you and how you have reached out to a perfect "stranger"  I will keep you posted.  Always my thoughts go with you all too....... Much peace in your journeys.  Carrie
Posts.Title: Now what to do? ccare ccare

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2008 07:35AM ccare wrote: Hi,  just a quick update.  I did hear from my surgeon's office and they wanted to know the details of my experience.  That was good. They were great.  I stayed focused on the facts.  As it turns out that was not the regular radiologist, he was covering as it was the day after Christmas.  The surgeon has not gotten his report or pics.   She is waiting on the pics and reports to determine the next step. She too was concerned about how it all went down and that he decided not to do one of the 4 (I thought two, but I guess there were a total of 4 being done) that she ordered.  More waiting but there is movement and that is really good.  The little things mean so much......
Posts.Title: Now what to do? ccare ccare

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2009 06:10PM ccare wrote: Thank you so much Deanna.  I am so glad I came here too!  Everything you said is right on.  I am in a totally different place and feeling strong again.  I really look forward to the new consult and the next steps.  It really is because of you and all that helped me here that I was able to learn and do what I needed to do.  There are no words that could ever express my gratitude.  I will be back after the 2nd and keep you posted.  If I can ever return the love and support.....Thank you for your care it made all the difference.
Posts.Title: Now what to do? ccare ccare

Posts.Content: Jan 1, 2009 05:54PM ccare wrote: Never heard from the surgeon only her office assistant on Wed. who said Dr. wanted me to know she looked at the pics again and feels they are benign...that's it.  I asked what they were, "Milk of Calcium?" but office assistant did not know said only that Dr. wanted to see me again in March.....Asked about the FBD, she also did not know and as she said, "I don't see it in this report I'm not sure what she thinks about that."  With regard to the experience at the BCC she stated that I probably got upset because I wanted someone to explain to me what was going on and he did not explain it to my satisfaction.....On Wed. afternoon I had my records transferred to another MD at KU.  I don't doubt dx, I am very lucky.....I just don't understand how all this was handled, all I wanted was a decent conversation with the doc. to understand.  Not much more to say.  Thank you for listening.  Always my best and my gratitude.  I wish you all continued strength , recovery and healing.   Peace, Carrie
Posts.Title: Now what to do? ccare ccare

Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2009 10:40PM ccare wrote: Hi.  I promised I would give the update.  I did see another surgeon.  What a great and different experience.  Everything was done completely over and I am blessed that so far the microcals are B9 and will now be watched very closely.  I will now be followed by a HR clinic.  Genetic testing has been discussed but we'll see.  Few words will ever be able to express my gratitude for all of your kindness.   I wish you love, support, strength, courage and healing.    Much peace in your journey.  Carrie
